trigger_event: trigger_event: After a tense midnight walk and a conversation with Alex at the fading neon-lit bar, Sven receives decrypted system logs revealing Halden's 'resilience test'—a switch that can plunge the city into BCI blindness or leave the neighborhoods to make their own path.
dilemma: Sven stands at the crossroads: Will he press the button and shatter the illusion, forcing the Council and citizens to confront one another in chaos, or will he empower neighborhoods to carve out their own destiny, relinquishing central order for a chance at true grassroots reinvention?
reason: Both choices risk chaos and transformation, but their consequences are unpredictable. Sven struggles between his belief in orchestrated radical reform and his intrigue with local revolutions born from the ground up—mirroring debates spurred by his interaction with Alex.
choice_a: Trigger Halden's 'resilience test,' cutting off BCI scores citywide and forcing the Council into open, direct debate with citizens.
belief_a: Public confrontation is the only catalyst for real reform.
Orderly breakdown is safer than uncontrolled implosion.
The Council must be forced to face ordinary citizens, not hide behind protocols.
choice_b: Encourage neighborhoods to hack and replace BCI locally, sparking citywide experiments in new governance while the Council loses control.
belief_b: True legitimacy must grow from local creativity, not central enforcement.
The system is already broken—only new models born from the people have hope.
Imposed reform is still a mask for old failures; local rebellion gives birth to something new.
